definitions.definition: an object such as a silver cup that is given as a prize for winning a competition

examples.text: The club haven't won a major trophy for the past three seasons.
He picked up a trophy for best news editor.
Portugal will be defending the trophy they won last year.
The team paraded their League Championship trophy.

definitions.definition: used in the names of some competitions and races in which a trophy is given to the winner
an object that you keep to show that you were successful in something, especially hunting or war

wordOrigin: late 15th cent. (in sense (3)): from French trophée, via Latin from Greek tropaion, from tropē ‘a rout’, from trepein ‘to turn’.
